intro: Elatostema obscurinerve var. pubifolium, commonly known as the hairy-veined elatostema, is a species native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape, with prominent veins that give the plant its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
